clinical_study.brief_title: Risk Factors of Rebleeding After Peptic Ulcer Bleeding: a Nationwide Cohort Study
clinical_study.official_title: Risk Factors of Rebleeding After Peptic Ulcer Bleeding: a Nationwide Cohort Study

oversight_info.authority: Korea: National Strategic Coordinating Center for Clinical Research

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the investigators study is to investigate the factors associated with rebleeding in patients with peptic ulcer bleeding.

detailed_description.textblock: The investigators are performing a nationwide population based cohort study to investigate the factors associated with rebleeding in patients with peptic ulcer bleeding. The results of the investigators study should give us information about patients who are at high risk of rebleeindg and enable us to manage these patients appropriately.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective

primary_outcome.measure: Rebleeding rate of peptic ulcer bleeding
primary_outcome.description: The rebleeding rate of patients diagnosed with peptic ulcer ble4eding

secondary_outcome.measure: Mortality rates of peptic ulcer bleeding
secondary_outcome.description: The 30 day mortality rate of patients diagnosed with peptic ulcer bleeding

study_pop.textblock: Patients who visit the hospital with symptoms suggestive of peptic ulcer bleeding such as melena or hematemesis. These patients recieve endoscopy and when they are diagnosed with peptic ulcer bleeding are eligible for enrollment.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients diagnosed with peptic ulcer bleeding by endoscopy
- Patients who consent to be enrolled in the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who refuse to be enrolled in the study
